ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about writing theses, different strategies and steps to create the essay and research tips.

This course walks students through a lot of the basics of writing a research paper. While I learned some helpful tidbits, I overall felt that the course was geared towards writers with fairly little experience, and some of the lessons seemed a little repetitive.
I think this class benefits students by giving more structure to their thesis writing and research. It gives you an idea of the research process, ideation and writing process for a longer project.
I learned how to write a senior thesis and it was especially helpful in breaking it down

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I noticed that the people in the class doing creative projects for their thesis didn't necessarily get the same skill building, because not everyone was writing a full research paper thesis.

I enjoy the small class size and ability to have so much support through the beginning process of the thesis. I wish that we had more of a focus on our small workshop groups such that a few times in the semester we just met separately with our groups to check-in and read/write.

This course is a great way for ER&M students to convene and learn together! It was really exciting to learn about my peers' projects and hear their feedback. 

I think the course could be improved by adding emphasis on the peer review and collaboration, and decreasing the amount of time spent on basic writing skills. At one point, we were placed in "reading groups," but never met with those groups again to discuss our projects together. A model that focuses on students' actual projects would also be more inclusive of students who are not writing final papers, and it would be possible to direct students towards the writing center/textual resources to cover citation practice, the basics of writing a research paper, etc.

I think the class was helpful in having the opportunity to learn about peer ER&M student thesis, though I think it would be beneficial for students to have projects that help build towards the research and writing in a more substantial way. Instructions for assignments were not always clear and were sometimes not given in writing with rubrics being provided only after assignments were graded.
I think the syllabus was thorough enough!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely take this if you're doing a full year thesis!
Yea! It's great to have space to work with others in ER&M on your thesis and be able to think through challenges and confusions in community.
Yes! Its probably the best course you can take to learn how to write a thesis!
